text: small rockets whizzing through the
inside of the body it may seem like
technology relegated to science fiction
movies but researchers at the University
of California in San Diego have taken a
step closer to making the fanciful
notion a reality the group led by nano
engineer Joseph Wang has developed a
micro rocket that uses acid as a fuel
previous micro rockets from Wang's group
and others ran on hydrogen peroxide
which had to be added to the solution
the rocket was zooming through these new
rockets however could work in native
environments that contain strong acids
like the stomach the tubular rockets are
composed of an outer layer of
polyaniline and an inner layer of zinc
it's this zinc layer that's the engine
of the rocket acid protons get reduced
on the zinc surface and converted into
hydrogen which forms bubbles and pushes
the rocket forward Hwang and his group
showed the new rockets are speediest in
concentrated hydrochloric acid run
slower in sulfuric acid and move slower
yet in phosphoric acid the researchers
also show that the tiny motors can be
manipulated by adding an outer layer of
titanium and nickel to the rocket body a
magnetic field like the one used in an
MRI machine can then direct the motion
of the rocket which is coated in a
magnetic metal film because of this
addition weighing in his group can also
pick up a magnetic polystyrene micro
bead through magnet magnet attraction
carry it and release the bead on command
by rapidly reversing the field
